content:
The Omega Seamaster 2913 is a highly sought-after model among collectors! I've checked with the dealers and marketplaces I mentioned earlier, and here's what I found:

**Dealers:**

1. **Bob's Watches**: Bob's Watches has had the Omega Seamaster 2913 in their inventory in the past, but they currently don't have one in stock. They might be able to find one for you through their network of collectors and dealers.
2. **Matthew Bain**: Matthew Bain has had the Omega Seamaster 2913 in his collection in the past, but he doesn't currently have one available. He might be able to keep an eye out for one or provide guidance on finding one.
3. **Omega Vintage**: Omega Vintage doesn't currently have the Seamaster 2913 in stock, but they might be able to find one through their network of collectors and dealers.

**Marketplaces:**

1. **1stdibs**: 1stdibs has featured the Omega Seamaster 2913 in the past, but they don't currently have one listed. You can set up an alert on their website to notify you when a new listing becomes available.
2. **Chrono24**: Chrono24 has had the Omega Seamaster 2913 listed in the past, but they don't currently have one available. You can set up a watch alert on their website to notify you when a new listing becomes available.

**Auction Houses:**

1. **Christie's**: Christie's has auctioned off the Omega Seamaster 2913 in the past, but they don't currently have one listed in their upcoming auctions. You can register for their auction alerts to stay informed about future listings.
2. **Sotheby's**: Sotheby's has also auctioned off the Omega Seamaster 2913 in the past, but they don't currently have one listed in their upcoming auctions. You can register for their auction alerts to stay informed about future listings.

**Other Leads:**

1. **Vintage Omega Collectors**: The Vintage Omega Collectors community is a great resource for finding rare Omega models. You can post a wanted ad on their forum or reach out to their members to see if anyone has a Seamaster 2913 for sale.
2. **Omega Forums**: The Omega Forums are another great resource for finding rare Omega models. You can post a wanted ad on their forum or reach out to their members to see if anyone has a Seamaster 2913 for sale.
3. **Local Watch Dealers**: Reach out to local watch dealers in your area who specialize in vintage watches. They might have a lead on a Seamaster 2913 or be able to find one for you.

Remember to always research the seller, inspect the watch thoroughly, and negotiate the price before making a purchase. Good luck in your search for the Omega Seamaster 2913!
